result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
9:22 AM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Julian Marrufo
Defendant Christopher Duane Tripp in court. 

Defendant wants to be represented by counsel.
Defendant to apply at Public Defender's Office for representation (may not qualify - makes too much money $34 per hour).
Next court date will be to address status of counsel.
Status conference scheduled for November 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on November 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on September 30, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Comply with all licensing restrictions. Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.

01:43 PM Defendant Christopher Duane Tripp in court, in custody, with attorney Angela Wang,as a friend of the Court.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 09:00 am.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
